triples.name: Fixation index
triples.relevance: A statistic from evolutionary theory applied to measure cultural differentiation between populations.

triples.name: World Values Survey
triples.relevance: A global research project providing cultural beliefs and behavioral data across countries used as the foundation for measuring cultural distance.

triples.name: The WEIRDest People in the World
triples.relevance: The concept of WEIRD psychology highlighting the overrepresentation of Western, educated, industrialized, rich, and democratic samples in psychological research.

triples.name: Psychological distance
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel tool and method for measuring psychological distance between societies and creating distance scales for comparative psychology research.

triples.name: Cross-cultural psychology
triples.relevance: The paper proposes distance measurements and methodologies to advance cross-cultural psychology by enabling systematic comparison of psychological differences between societies.
